resources.string: We believe in the power of home made food
We believe in the power of home made food

Data about your interactions and usage of the Philips digital channels, such as social media, websites, email, apps and connected products. This data may include: IP address. cookies, device information, communications you click on, location details, and websites you visit.
Data we get from your interactions with Philips
Data that you want to actively share with us such as: your name, date of birth or age, email address, physical address, country, gender, phone number, social media profile.

"As a result of your consent, Philips group companies may contact you with promotional communications - based on your preferences and behaviour - about Philips products, services, events and promotions.
We may contact you via email, SMS and other digital channels, such as mobile apps and social media. To be able to tailor the communications to your preferences and behavior and provide you with the best, personalized experience, we may analyze and combine your personal data."
Philips will give you the opportunity to withdraw your consent at any time.
Category tags make your recipe easy to find.

Airfryer has downloaded the update and it’s now installing. We can’t connect until it’s finished, which can take some time. We’ll reconnect automatically.
Airfryer is downloading an available update and preparing for later installation. While download is in progress, communication with the Airfryer may have some delay.
Airfryer firmware update is in progress. You will be notified when download has finished and installation process has begun.
Air Cooker is downloading an available update and preparing for later installation. While download is in progress, communication with the Air Cooker may have some delay.
Your Air Cooker is currently updating. The Air Cooker dedicated actions will be disabled until update is finished.

"If you remove your Airfryer, you won't recieve personalized recommendations."
If you remove your NutriMax, you won’t be able to change cooking instructions remotely, or use any Smart cooking features.
If you remove your Airfryer, you won’t be able to change cooking instructions remotely, or use any Smart cooking features.
Namely wheat (such as spelt, Khorasan wheat/Kamut), rye, barley, oats, or their hybridised strains
For example crab, lobster, crayfish, shrimp, prawn
Namely almonds, hazelnuts, walnuts, cashews, pecans, brazils, pistachios, macadamia nuts or Queensland nuts and products thereof
At concentration of more than ten parts per million
You can always connect your Amazon account in settings.
Connect to your Amazon account for extra benefits
"Sorry, something went wrong. Announcement failed to load, please try again."

It appears that there is a problem with the app. A bug report was automatically sent to the developer.
It looks like Kitchen+ is already connected with Amazon Alexa. Go back to keep enjoying hands-free cooking or disconnect below.
Kitchen+ is already connected with Alexa

"The Kitchen Plus Skill allows you to control your Philips Airfryer and obtain information via Amazon Alexa. When you enable the Skill, Philips allows you to connect your Amazon Account to the Philips account you use to log in to the Kitchen Plus app. When connecting your accounts, Philips and Amazon independently adopt technical measures to validate your identity. Philips does not share your account credentials, including name or email address, with Amazon.
When you speak to Alexa, Amazon sends a written version of your voice commands to Philips together with a unique identifier. We process this information to execute your commands and issue a response in accordance with our Privacy Notice. We share our written response with Amazon so that Amazon can inform you about the outcome of your command in accordance with Amazon’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. Philips and Alexa may also exchange information on the Airfryer you decide to control through the Skill, including when you update, change or remove a device.
You understand that your commands and responses amount to personal data. You also understand that Amazon provides its own services to you and by providing consent, you instruct us to share your personal data with Amazon. Amazon may process your personal data in countries outside of your country of residence which may not provide adequate protection to personal data. You can revoke your consent at any time by disabling the Skill."
Amazon consent is required for account linking. By revoking your consent, your account will get unlinked from Amazon and you will not be able to use voice control.
I want to activate the Kitchen Plus skill and share my information with Amazon to receive voice services
Log in or create an Amazon account
Start using voice control with your Aifryer
Connect Kitchen+ with Amazon Alexa for hands-free cooking.
That’s it! Now you’re free to enjoy hands-free cooking with your Airfryer.
Well done! Kitchen+ is connected with Alexa
Connect your smart home device app to use voice control
If you used the Alexa app to connect with Kitchen+, please disconnect using the Alexa app too.
" If you disconnect your Amazon account, Alexa will not be able to access your Airfryer for hands-free cooking."

Amounts are per serving. One serving is 1/%s of \"%s\" recipe.

Kitchen+ sends recipe and ingredient data to the blender so that recipes can be prepared and created on the blender. Kitchen+ receives data from recipe preparation and blender usage so that coaching and guidance functionality can be provided and improvements can be made to app and appliance based on actual usage.
Something went wrong. Your settings could not be saved successfully.
By pairing via Bluetooth you allow Kitchen+ to transfer recipe, nutrition and usage data between phone and blender.

"This chart shows how many kilocalories are in the uncooked recipe.
Kilocalories are equal to the energy in one serving and are divided into fats, carbs and proteins.
Your diet is divided into other nutrients, such as fiber or alcohol."

"This chart shows how many kilocalories are in the uncooked recipe.
For example, if you prepare food in heat with an Airfryer, it may reduce the amount of fat in the ingredients and the kilocalories per serving.
Kilocalories are equal to the energy in one serving and are divided into fats, carbs and proteins.
\"Other\" contains kilocalories which are coming for example from alcohol. "

"This chart shows how many kilocalories are in the recipe.
Kilocalories are equal to the energy in one serving and are divided into fats, carbs and proteins.
\"Other\" contains kilocalories which are coming for example from alcohol."

"Energy is shown based on one serving. This recipe contains %s servings. The Daily Values are for a 2,000 kilocalories per day diet. Your recommended intake changes to match your age, height, weight and activity level.
If you personalized your nutritional profile, the graph will reflect these values."
* Recommended nutrient intake (RNI) is the daily recommended amount of nutrients you should eat based on your personalized nutritional intake of %s kilocalories.
The Daily Values are for a %s kilocalories per day diet. Your recommended intake is based on an average adult.
* Recommended nutrient intake (RNI) is the daily recommended amount of nutrients you should eat based on your personalized nutritional intake of %s kilocalories.

* Recommended nutrient intake (RNI) is the daily recommended amount of nutrients you should eat based on a %s kilocalorie diet. If you set your personal RNI in the app, the calculations of RNI%% are based on your profile.
Daily Values are based on %s kilocalories diet. Your own recommended intake will vary based on factors like age, height, weight and activity level.
Daily Values are based on your recommended %s kilocalories diet.

Use a Dry Microfiber or a Lens Cloth. One of the easiest methods is wiping down your phone camera lens with a dry microfiber or a lens cloth.
Meals under natural light look more natural and display more details in your food.
The meal itself shouldn’t fill the entire frame, two-thirds of the photo should be negative space. That helps the subject to stand out even more.
This view shows the meal as if you’re looking down at it from an angle. It is considered the best angle for capturing meals.

"\"Dear test person, the home application test with the Philips Air Cooker and the associated app has ended. Thank you for your participation and your valuable feedback!
Please uninstall this test app from your smartphone. As you were informed at the beginning of the study, you will not be able to continue with your created test account after the end of the test.
To continue enjoying the benefits of the NutriU app, install the Philips NutriU app on your phone and create a new account.
We look forward to welcoming you to a consumer test again soon.
Your Philips product test center.”"

Sign up for the exclusive Philips Newsletter here and receive a 10 € welcome voucher * for signing up. Also get information about product launches and news, invitations to free product testing, and helpful tips on our products, offers, and services.

*You will receive the voucher by E-Mail after confirming your E-Mail address. The voucher is valid for new subscribers from a minimum order value of 30 €. It is valid 14 days after successful registration for the Philips online shop and cannot be combined with other discounts.
Thanks for subscribing! Stay tuned for special offers, tips & tricks.

Per 1 September Domestic Appliances is an independent company and no longer a part of Philips. The app is presented to you by Domestic Appliances. "This App uses Adobe Analytics, an analytics service (“Adobe Analytics”) provided by Adobe Systems Software Ireland Limited (“Adobe”). Adobe Analytics uses “cookies” or similar techniques, which are text files placed in your App, in order to help the App to analyze overall traffic patterns through our App. When transmitting the information generated by the cookie about the use of the App to Adobe, Adobe ensures that your IP address is anonymized before geo-localization can be used and replaces it with a generic IP address before storage. On behalf of Philips, Adobe will use this information for the evaluation of your use of the App, compiling reports on App activity for Philips, and in order to provide other services relating to App activity and use of the App to Philips. Adobe will not associate your IP address with any other data held by Adobe.
The App uses Apptentive, a feedback and communication service (“Apptentive”) provided by Apptentive Inc. Apptentive uses a technology similar to a “cookie” in order to help the App analyze the overall traffic patterns and collect your feedback through the App. On behalf of Philips, Apptentive will use information about your device (such as manufacturer, model, and operating system), App usage patterns, and information you choose to provide (such as survey responses or feedback) to provide services to Philips to help them understand App usage, provide support, and improve their products and services. Your IP address is anonymized prior to use and storage within Apptentive's products and services.
This App uses Google Firebase, an app development service (“Firebase”) provided by Google Ireland Ltd. (“Google”). Firebase uses “cookies” or similar techniques- SDK, which are text files placed in your App and web browser. On behalf of Philips, Firebase will use information from your device such as your Device ID, IP address, your IDFA or Google Play Services ID and your MAC address, and replace them with a unique code. When you use the App we will measure the numbers of visits to the App, which pages you visit, your network connection, load times and when the App crashes. We use this information to evaluate and understand your use of the App, to test and analyze performance and ultimately optimize our products and services.
The App uses Branch Metrics to deep-link users into the App and to analyze how users access and use the App (“Branch’). On behalf of Philips Branch Metrics will use information generated about your use of the App (such as the mobile platform, timestamp, API key (identifier for application), App version, device identifier, iOS Identifier for Advertising, iOS Identifier for Vendors, Android Advertiser ID, IP address, the device model, manufacturer and device O/S, session start/stop time, mobile network code and network status) and transmit and store such data on the servers of Branch Metrics. We use Branch for the purpose of evaluating your use of the App and compiling reports on App activity. For more information visit: https://branch.io/policies/#privacy
You can prevent collection and use of data (cookies and IP address) if you opt-out after you close this screen."

"Adobe Analytics. This App uses Adobe Analytics, an analytics service (“Adobe Analytics”) provided by Adobe Systems Software Ireland Limited (“Adobe”). Adobe Analytics uses “cookies” or similar techniques, which are text files placed in your App, in order to help the App to analyze overall traffic patterns through our App. By transmitting the information generated by the cookie about the use of the App to Adobe, Adobe ensures that your IP address is anonymized before geo-localization can be used and is replaced by a generic IP address before storage. On behalf of Philips Domestic Appliances, Adobe will use this information for the evaluation of your use of the App, compiling reports on App activity for Philips Domestic Appliances, and in order to provide other services relating to App activity and use of the App to Philips Domestic Appliances. Adobe will not associate your IP address with any other data held by Adobe.
Apptentive. This App uses Apptentive, a feedback and communication service (\"Apptentive\") provided by Apptentive Inc. Apptentive uses a technology similar to a \"cookie\" in order to help the App analyze the overall traffic patterns and collect your feedback through the App. On behalf of Philips, Apptentive will use information about your mobile device (such as manufacturer, model, and operating system), App usage patterns, and information you choose to provide (such as survey responses or feedback) to provide services to Philips to help them understand App usage, provide support, and improve their products and services. Your IP address is anonymized prior to use and storage within Apptentive's products and services.
Branch Metrics. This App uses Branch Metrics, a service provided by Branch Metrics Inc. (“Branch”), to deep-link users into the App, analyze how users access and use the App and use these insights to improve the App. On behalf of Philips Domestic Appliances, Branch will process information generated about your use of the App (such as the mobile platform, timestamp, API key (identifier for application), App version, mobile device identifier, iOS Identifier for Advertising, iOS Identifier for Vendors, Android Advertiser ID, IP address, the mobile device model, manufacturer and device O/S, session start/stop time, mobile network code and network status). If you download the App by clicking on a Philips Domestic Appliances Ad on one of our marketing partners’ platforms, such as Facebook, Apple or Google, and decide to provide consent, Branch will collect Ad measurement data from your mobile device, including unique identifiers and analytics data on the Ad that you click on and other App events (such as first install, open and App sharing via the App’s sharing feature). To understand the effectiveness of our advertising campaigns and measure engagement, we share your Ad measurement data with the platform we used to run the Ad, which will then use the data to report on the effectiveness of our Ads. By consenting to the use of Branch, you agree to the sharing of your Ad measurement data with the platform you used when clicking on our Ad, such as Facebook, Apple or Google, as it may be the case, which platform will process your data in accordance with its Privacy Notice (Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/privacy/explanation; Apple: https://www.apple.com/privacy/; Google: https://policies.google.com/privacy).
Google Firebase. This App uses Google Firebase, an app development service (“Firebase”) provided by Google Ireland Ltd. (“Google”). Firebase uses “cookies” or similar techniques, which are text files placed in your App and web browser. On behalf of Philips Domestic Appliances, Firebase will use information from your mobile device such as your device ID, IP address, your IDFA or Google Play Services ID and your MAC address, and replace them with a unique code. When you use the App we will measure the numbers of visits to the App, which pages you visit, your network connection, load times and when the App crashes. We use this information to evaluate and understand your use of the App, to test and analyze performance and ultimately optimize our products and services.
You can prevent collection and use of data (cookies and IP address) if you opt-out after you close this screen. "
In order for us to show you the right content and provide our services, we process your personal data. Please read the Privacy Notice to learn more.
When you share your app data and cookies, we can keep improving Kitchen+ and giving you a helpful and personalized experience.
Photos you add will be stored on our servers and may be viewed by other users using this app.

We use location services to connect to your Airfryer. Without this permission your phone can’t control your Airfryer or share recipes and cooking instructions.

"We use location information to connect to your Airfryer. Without this information, your phone can't control your Airfryer or share recipes and cooking instructions.
Please make sure that both location permission and location services are enabled. You can enable location services in Privacy Settings and location permission in the app settings."
We use location services to connect to your NutriMax. Without this permission your phone can’t control your NutriMax or share recipes and cooking instructions.
Without location services the app won’t know which Wi-Fi network your Airfryer is on and won’t be able to connect with it.
Without location services the app won’t know which Wi-Fi network your NutriMax is on and won’t be able to connect with it.
